metadata.dc:author: Montes Plaza, J M
Valda Rodrigo, J
Rubio Sanz, M J
Marcos Pérez, S M
metadata.dc:description: The Paget disease is a chronic osteodystrophy of unknown etiology, very frequent in 50 years of age and above. It's an anatomo-radiologic syndrome that sometimes, is accompanied by clinical symptoms. May be monostotic or polyostotic but never generalized. Occasionally it affects the temporal bone producing deafness, tinnitus and vertigo. We report a case with important temporal bone demineralization, deafness and vertigo.
metadata.dc:title: Enfermedad de Paget con afectación del hueso temporal, hipoacusia y vértigos. A propósito de un caso.
[Paget's disease with temporal bone involvement, hypoacusis and vertigo. Apropos a case].
